discussion.content: C&E not D

Selected Answer: BE
B&E are correct answers, because they directly address the coordination issue by clarifying the workflow and prioritizing issues that impact the iteration goal.

Selected Answer: CE
B is not a PMP way of thinking.

Selected Answer: CE
C&E is correct

Selected Answer: AE
A. In retrospective the team talks about the last iteration, lessons learnt and how to they can improve, backlog refinement is a responsibility of the product owner. Backlog refinement is not used for revisiting issues its simply for reprioritization of user stories and issues.
E. Prioritize issues focusing on the one that affects the goals is what needs to be done.

Selected Answer: CE
By combining a collaborative backlog refinement meeting with prioritization of critical issues, the project manager can effectively address the coordination challenges, empower the team to find solutions, and ensure progress towards the iteration goal despite the difficulties with the critical deliverable.

Selected Answer: CD
In a situation where a critical deliverable is causing difficulties, and the work is not well-coordinated among team members, the project manager should take actions to address the issues and improve team performance. Two appropriate actions are:

C. Schedule an iteration backlog refinement meeting to understand the issues.

By scheduling an iteration backlog refinement meeting, the project manager can gather the team to discuss and understand the issues that are affecting the current iteration. This meeting can help in identifying bottlenecks, clarifying requirements, and addressing any misunderstandings or coordination problems.
D. Set up one-on-one meetings to provide feedback to the team members.

Conducting one-on-one meetings with team members allows the project manager to provide personalized feedback, understand individual concerns, and address any performance issues. This can help in building a better understanding of the challenges faced by each team member and providing support where needed.

comments.content: N.B: Option E - Prioritizing issues is important, but it should be done in conjunction with understanding the root causes. The iteration backlog refinement meeting (Option C) would provide a platform for prioritizing and addressing issues in a collaborative manner.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
CE is the answer

Selected Answer: BE
When a critical deliverable is causing difficulties, and there are coordination issues among team members, the project manager should take the following two actions:

B. Provide clear instructions on how the work should flow among the team members: Clear and well-defined processes and workflows can help address coordination issues. Providing guidance on how work should be organized, assigned, and executed can improve coordination and reduce the emergence of functionality and quality issues.

E. Prioritize the issues, focusing on the ones affecting the iteration goal: It's important to prioritize and address the issues that are directly impacting the current iteration's goal and progress. By focusing on the most critical issues first, the project manager can help the team overcome immediate obstacles and maintain progress.

Selected Answer: CE
A. Develop a team performance report to discuss in the next retrospective meeting. It´s Agile no need to develop team performance, the team will feel the wrong result directly into the retrospective.
B. Provide dear instructions on how the work should flow among the team members. Most Voted. It´s Agile, PM doesn´t provide clear instructions, PM empower the team.
C. Schedule an iteration backlog refinement meeting to understand the issues. It´s Agile, PM is a facilitator, PM will facilitate to schedule a backlog refinement and the team will understand where the problems are and will decide how to fix it.
D. Set up one-on-one meetings to provide feedback to the team members. Agile is a TEAM, it´s not an issue related to individual ones.
E. Prioritize the issues, focusing on the ones affecting the iteration goal. PM can prioritize the issues with the Team showing them how to do where they are going to learn

Selected Answer: BE
B. Provide dear instructions on how the work should flow among the team members
E. Prioritize the issues, focusing on the ones affecting the iteration goal

comments.content: I focused on what can be done in the CURRENT ITERATION. as opposed to what sounded like things done after or would take too long.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
C isn't applicable in this case. Do not mix it up with Retrospective. "During Backlog Refinement (Grooming) the Scrum Master facilitates as the Product Owner and Scrum Team review the user stories at the top of the Product Backlog in order to prepare for the upcoming sprint"

comments.content: You do realize that in PM the Scrum Master role is equivalent to the PM, don't you?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
The question is addressing team collaboration issue.
Option E cannot be right as it does not address team performance issue, its only prioritizing the backlog, not checking up the team performance.

Selected Answer: BC
Part of the question is work flow. B addresses work flow.

Selected Answer: BC
The project manager should first provide clear instructions on how the work should flow among the team members to ensure that there is no confusion about roles and responsibilities. The project manager should then schedule an iteration backlog refinement meeting to understand the issues and ensure that the team is aligned on what needs to be done. Developing a team performance report and providing feedback to individual team members through one-on-one meetings can also be helpful, but they may not address the root cause of the coordination issues. Prioritizing issues is also important, but it should be done in conjunction with the other actions.

comments.content: There is product backlog refinement but no iteration backlog refinement. It is because iteration is a very short period ranged from 1 to 4 weeks. The iteration backlog is chosen by the team collaborate based on the team's capacity at the sprint planning i.e before the sprint start. so C is not correct. I agreed "B", it is scrum master's responsibility to tell the vision, direction to the team. There is work flow issue so we have to resolve this issue so B is correct. i select B&E

questions.question_text:
A critical deliverable for the current iteration is giving the team difficulties. Functionality and quality issues are constantly emerging and delaying iteration progress.
The project manager listens to the team's concerns and discovered that the work is not being well coordinated among the team members.
Which two actions should the project manager take to handle this situation? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Talk to the team member to determine why their performance changed.
choices.D: Talk to the project lead and ask them to allocate less demanding tasks.
choices.B: Talk to the team member's manager to provide more training.
choices.C: Talk to the team member and a human resources (HR) representative.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Talk to the team member to determine why their performance changed

Selected Answer: A
To check on him

questions.question_text:
A project manager is managing a large project. During a review meeting, the project manager discovers that one of the team members who use to be a high performer was not able to complete their work on time.

What should the project manager do?

choices.B: Perform an analysis of the key cost drivers and present alternatives.
choices.A: Review the risk register and assign functional managers as resources.
choices.D: Review the work breakdown structure (WBS) to ensure there are adequate resources.
choices.C: Analyze the resource pool and assign internal resources who participated in past projects.

questions.question_text:
An organization is initiating a project that will be using new technology. The complexity of the project requires excellent technical skills. After reviewing the proposed project management plan, the project sponsor asks for options to reduce the labor cost without introducing risk to the project delivery.

What should the project manager do first?

discussion.content:

Team has to come to consensus for any work they perform, as a PM - his role is to facilitate communication towards and agreement.

choices.B: Prioritize the item flagged as high business value and low complexity for this sprint.
choices.D: Prioritize the item flagged as a dependency with low business value and high complexity.
choices.A: Support the team to move both items to the next sprint when the team will know more.
choices.C: Facilitate the discussion until the team reaches an agreement about the two items.

questions.question_text:
A project manager is using an agile approach. During the sprint planning meeting, the product owner flagged a backlog item as high business value and easy to implement. However, the other team members identified a high dependency between this item and another item that is flagged as low business value and high complexity.

What should the project manager do to support the backlog prioritization?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This is D

Selected Answer: C
What is available? Are historical data available? We don't know. I choose C.

Selected Answer: D
D. Three-point estimating.

Selected Answer: D
Three-point estimating involves considering optimistic, pessimistic, and most likely estimates to account for uncertainty. While it's commonly associated with activity duration estimates, it can also be applied to other project aspects, including software development time. In this case, the lack of specific experience might warrant a more probabilistic approach to estimation.
Analogous Estimating: It relies on historical data from similar projects to make estimates for the current project.
Parametric Estimating: This involves using a statistical relationship between historical data and other variables to calculate an estimate.
Suitable when a measurable parameter (like cost per unit) can be identified and applied to the current project.
Planning Poker: It is a consensus-based technique used in Agile projects where team members collectively estimate the effort required for user stories.

Selected Answer: B
B. Parametric estimating

Parametric estimating involves using statistical relationships between historical data and other variables to calculate an estimate for the work. Since the software developers are new to the company and have no previous experience with a similar application, parametric estimating can be a suitable technique. It relies on parameters such as cost per unit, lines of code, or other relevant metrics to estimate the time required for the project.

Analogous estimating relies on historical data from similar projects, which may not be available in this case. Planning poker and three-point estimating are more suitable for situations where team members have some knowledge or experience that can contribute to the estimation process, which may not be the case for new team members working on a new type of project.

Selected Answer: D
D. Three-point estimating

Reasoning:

Without prior similar projects to draw upon (as would be used in Analogous estimating), Three-point estimating would be a suitable method. It allows the developers to consider optimistic, pessimistic, and most likely scenarios for each task, which can be especially useful when there's uncertainty or limited prior experience with similar projects. This technique provides a range for estimation, taking into account potential uncertainties and risks.

Analogous - Limited amount of info. Less cost and time to make but less accurate. Best to use with people with similar experience.

PERT Three-point - many unknown

Parametric - Needs details but super accurate.

It's PERT. Details from PMBOK

Selected Answer: D
Analogous estimating is a top-down estimation technique that relies on historical data or expert judgment from similar projects
Parametric estimating uses statistical relationships between variables to calculate an estimate for the projec
Planning Poker:

Planning poker is an estimation technique commonly used in agile methodologies like Scrum. It involves team members providing their estimates for user stories or tasks by playing cards with numbers representing the effort required
Three-point estimating is a technique that considers the uncertainty and variability of estimates.

Selected Answer: A
A. Analogous estimating

Selected Answer: C
Planning Poker allows the entire team, including the new software developers, to provide their individual estimates for tasks or user stories. It fosters collaboration and discussion among team members, which can be beneficial when there is a lack of experience with a specific task or project. The technique leverages the collective expertise and judgment of the team to arrive at a consensus estimate. It is particularly useful in Agile projects and when there is limited historical data available.

On the other hand, the Three-Point Estimating technique might require more historical data or experience to provide reliable optimistic, pessimistic, and most likely estimates. If the team lacks experience and relevant data, the Three-Point Estimating technique might not be as effective in this particular scenario.

Selected Answer: D
Since the developers have had similar experience, they should use 3 points estimating technique

the key of the question is they have never developed a similar application. Analogous and parametric estimate based on historical data, planning poker is to prioritize user story. the answer is D, Pert estimating

Selected Answer: A
Analogous estimating is a technique that uses information from a similar past project in order to estimate the cost and duration of a planned project. This approach is often used when there is limited data available for a project, making it difficult to generate accurate estimates.

Just because the developers are new to the company and have never worked on software development as such, doesn't mean that the company didn't do past projects that are similar and can provide an Analogous estimate.

comments.content:
Nowhere in the question does it state, or even hint, that the company has performed a similar project in the past though. Maybe this is a completely new type of software application? we don't know. 

Since the devs are new, the PM doesn't know their work velocity. And since the dev's haven't done this before, they'll be totally guessing. So a three point estimate (D) makes sense to me.

PERT = (O + M*4 + P) / 6
O = Optimistic Estimate
M = Most Likely Estimate
P = Pessimistic Estimate

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Planning Poker is an estimation technique for Agile to determine the development effort.

comments.content: Planning poker is story point estimation in agile but it is performed by the team. The question only mention the developer only not the team to do the estimation so C is not correct

Planning poker is a gamified technique that development teams use to guess the effort of project management tasks. These estimations are based on the entire group’s input and consensus, making them more engaging and accurate than other methods.

In other words they have to have a clue about the software they are developing.

3-Points use the three figures that are produced initially for every distribution that is required, based on prior experience or best-guesses:
The first is a most likely (M)/best guess (BG) which is the average amount of work the task might take if the team member performed it 100 times. The second estimate is the pessimistic (P) estimate which is the amount of work the task might take if the negative factors they identified do occur. The third estimate is the optimistic (O) estimate which is the amount of work the task might take if the positive risks they identified do occur.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Three points estimating (option D) is correct, because analogous estimating (option A) is also based on historical data from similar projects, but since the developers have no prior experience with such projects, this technique may not be applicable.

Selected Answer: A
Given that the software developers are new to the company and have no prior experience with the project, the most appropriate estimation technique would be analogous estimating. This technique involves using similar historical data from previous projects to estimate the time required for the new project. This technique is useful when there is limited information available about the current project, making it difficult to use more detailed estimation techniques. Therefore, option A (Analogous estimating) would be the best estimation technique to recommend in this scenario.

A. Analogous estimating.

Analogous estimating is the most appropriate estimation technique to use when the software developers are new to the company and have never developed a similar application. Analogous estimating uses historical data from similar projects to estimate the duration, cost, or effort required for a current project.

Since the developers are new to the company and have no prior experience with similar applications, there is no data available to use for parametric estimating or three-point estimating.
If the developers don't have any clue. It is better to use historical info for the estimates. I think the answer will be "A"
Answer is A

questions.question_text:
A project manager meets with the development team to estimate the time required to complete a software application. The software developers are new to the company, and they have never developed a similar application.

Which estimation technique should the project manager recommend?
